metadata.title: Unified Endpoint Management Agent Security Requirements Guide (Catalog)
metadata.remarks: This Security Requirements Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.

controls.title:
The UEM Agent must provide an alert via the trusted channel to the UEM Server in the event of any of the following audit events:
-successful application of policies to a mobile device
-receiving or generating periodic reachability events
-change in enrollment state
-failure to install an application from the UEM Server
-failure to update an application from the UEM Server.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2 a on organization-defined information system components.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
The UEM Agent must provide an alert via the trusted channel to the UEM Server in the event of any of the following audit events:
-successful application of policies to a mobile device
-receiving or generating periodic reachability events
-change in enrollment state
-failure to install an application from the UEM Server
-failure to update an application from the UEM Server.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the UEM Agent to provide an alert via the trusted channel to the UEM Server in the event of any of the following audit events:
-successful application of policies to a mobile device 
-receiving or generating periodic reachability events 
-change in enrollment state
-failure to install an application from the UEM Server
-failure to update an application from the UEM Server.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Alerts providing notification of a change in enrollment state facilitate verification of the correct operation of security functions. When an UEM server receives such an alert from an UEM Agent, it indicates the security policy may no longer be enforced on the mobile device. This enables the UEM administrator to take an appropriate remedial action.

Satisfies: FAU_ALT_EXT.2.1
Reference: PP-UEM-402001, PP-UEM-402002, PP-MDM-402003

parts.name: assessment-method
parts.prose: Verify configuration meets the statement and guidance.

controls.title: The UEM Agent must generate a UEM Agent audit record of the following auditable events:-startup and shutdown of the UEM Agent-UEM policy updated-any modification commanded by the UEM Server.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2 a on organization-defined information system components.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The UEM Agent must generate a UEM Agent audit record of the following auditable events:-startup and shutdown of the UEM Agent-UEM policy updated-any modification commanded by the UEM Server.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the UEM Agent to generate an UEM Agent audit record of the following auditable events:
-Startup and shutdown of the UEM Agent
-UEM policy updated
-any modification commanded by the UEM Server.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Without the capability to generate audit records, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident, or identify those responsible for one. 

Audit records can be generated from various components within the application (e.g., process, module). Certain specific application functionalities may be audited as well. The list of audited events is the set of events for which audits are to be generated. This set of events is typically a subset of the list of all events for which the system is capable of generating audit records.

DoD has defined the list of events for which the application will provide an audit record generation capability as the following: 

(i) Successful and unsuccessful attempts to access, modify, or delete privileges, security objects, security levels, or categories of information (e.g., classification levels);

(ii) Access actions, such as successful and unsuccessful logon attempts, privileged activities or other system level access, starting and ending time for user access to the system, concurrent logons from different workstations, successful and unsuccessful accesses to objects, all program initiations, and all direct access to the information system; and

(iii) All account creation, modification, disabling, and termination actions.

DoD Required auditable events include:
- Change in enrollment status
- Failure to apply policies to a mobile device
- Start up and shut down of the MDM System
- All administrative actions
- Commands issued to the MDM Agent.

Satisfies: FAU_GEN.1.1(2) Refinement

controls.title: The UEM Agent must be configured to enable the following function: read audit logs of the managed endpoint device.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2 a on organization-defined information system components.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The UEM Agent must be configured to enable the following function: read audit logs of the managed endpoint device.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Configure the UEM Agent to enable the following function: read audit logs of the managed endpoint device.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Audit logs and alerts enable monitoring of security-relevant events and subsequent forensics when breaches occur. They help identify when the security posture of the device is not as expected. This enables the UEM administrator to take an appropriate remedial action.

Satisfies: FMT_SMF_EXT.4.1
Reference: PP-UEM-401005

controls.title:
The UEM Agent must record within each UEM Agent audit record the following information:

-date and time of the event
-type of event
-subject identity
-(if relevant) the outcome (success or failure) of the event.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Ensure that audit records containing information that establishes where the event occurred.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
The UEM Agent must record within each UEM Agent audit record the following information:

-date and time of the event
-type of event
-subject identity
-(if relevant) the outcome (success or failure) of the event.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the UEM Agent to record within each UEM Agent audit record the following information:
-Date and time of the event
-type of event
-subject identity
-(if relevant) the outcome (success or failure) of the event.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Audit logs enable monitoring of security-relevant events and subsequent forensics when breaches occur. For audit logs to be useful, administrators must have the ability to view them.

Satisfies: FAU_GEN.1.2(2) Refinement

controls.title: The UEM Agent must not install policies if the policy-signing certificate is deemed invalid.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: For public key-based authentication, validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The UEM Agent must not install policies if the policy-signing certificate is deemed invalid.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Configure the UEM Agent to not install policies if the policy-signing certificate is deemed invalid.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
It is critical that the UEM agent only use validated certificates for policy updates. Otherwise, there is no assurance that a malicious actor has not inserted itself in the process of packaging the code or policy.

Satisfies: FMT_POL_EXT.2.2

controls.title: The UEM Agent must use managed endpoint device key storage for all persistent secret and private keys.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: For public key-based authentication, enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The UEM Agent must use managed endpoint device key storage for all persistent secret and private keys.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Configure the UEM Agent must use the managed endpoint device key storage for all persistent secret and private keys.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
If validated secure storage locations are not used for keys, they could be compromised.

Satisfies: FCS_STG_EXT.1(2)

controls.title:
The UEM Agent must perform the following functions: 

-enroll in management

-configure whether users can unenroll from management

-configure periodicity of reachability events.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
The UEM Agent must perform the following functions: 

-enroll in management

-configure whether users can unenroll from management

-configure periodicity of reachability events.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
Configure the UEM Agent to perform the following functions: 
-Enroll in management
-Configure whether users can unenroll from management
-Configure periodicity of reachability events.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Access control of mobile devices to DoD sensitive information or access to DoD networks must be controlled so that DoD data will not be compromised. The primary method of access control of mobile devices is via enrollment of authorized mobile devices on the UEM server. Therefore, the UEM server must have the capability to enforce a policy for this control.

Satisfies: FMT_SMF_EXT.4.2

controls.title: All UEM Agent cryptography supporting DoD functionality must be FIPS 140-2 validated.

props.name: cci
props.remarks: Implement organization-defined types of cryptography for each specified cryptography use.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: All UEM Agent cryptography supporting DoD functionality must be FIPS 140-2 validated.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Configure the UEM Agent cryptography supporting DoD functionality for FIPS 140-2 mode.

parts.name: vulnerability-discussion
parts.prose:
Unapproved cryptographic algorithms cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data could be compromised as a result. The most common vulnerabilities with cryptographic modules are those associated with poor implementation. FIPS 140-2 validation provides assurance that the relevant cryptography has been implemented correctly. FIPS 140-2 validation is also a strict requirement for use of cryptography in the federal government for protecting unclassified data.

Satisfies: FCS
Reference: PP-UEM-404200
